text: Kent Liston Lee (July 28, 1923 â€“ August 11, 2017) was a Vice Admiral of the United States Navy. The 36-year veteran of the Navy saw combat in World War II and commanded the aircraft carrier during the Vietnam War. He was best known for his work in driving the development and procurement of the F/A-18 Hornet. Lee died in Charlottesville, Virginia on August 11, 2017 at the age of 94.KENT LEE Obituary ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2017 deaths Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Military people from South Carolina
title: Kent Lee
